intro: Phloga scottiana, commonly known as the Scottish heath, is a flowering plant native to the Scottish Highlands. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, dark green leaves that are evergreen, providing year-round structure. Phloga scottiana plays an important ecological role in supporting local insect populations and contributing to the biodiversity of its native environment.
